## Sympy
```{python}
import sympy

x,y = sympy.symbols("x y")
sympy.Eq(y, 2*x)
```
- This shows an equation using sympy

## Table
```{python}
tax_policy = [
    [415050, .396],
    [413350, .35],
    [190150, .33],
    [91150, .28],
    [37650, .25],
    [9275, .15]
]
```

## Dataframe
```{python}
import pandas as pd

df = pd.DataFrame(tax_policy)
df.columns = ["Income Cutoff", "Marginal Rate"]
df
```

## Graph
```{python}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

plt.plot(df["Income Cutoff"], df["Marginal Rate"])
```

## Latex
##### Super cool LaTex equations


`$E=mc^2$`

- Single `$` used to insert equations on inline as seen below.

$E=mc^2$


```{=latex}
$$
\sum_{i=1}^n x_i 
$$
```

- Double `$$` used to insert equations centered.

$$
\sum_{i=1}^n x_i 
$$
